title: Dust sparked biggest phytoplankton bloom in decades
summary: New research reveals that dust carried by the wind from southern Africa towards Madagascar triggered the largest phytoplankton bloom in two decades – and, unusually, this occurred at a time of year when such blooms are rarely seen.

title: NASA’s Instruments Capture Sharpest Image of Earth’s Radiation Belt
summary: From Aug. 19-20, ESA’s (European Space Agency’s) Juice (Jupiter Icy Moons Explorer) mission made history with a daring lunar-Earth flyby and double gravity assist maneuver, a spaceflight first. As the spacecraft zipped past our Moon and home planet, Juice’s instruments came online for a dry run of what they’ll do when they reach Jupiter. During […]

title: Ground Game: Raytheon’s Mission Operations Centers Improve Forecasting for Civilian Space Missions

title: NASA removes technical details from Janus RFI
summary: After a four-week hiatus, NASA has republished a document seeking ideas for how to repurpose a pair of smallsats for an asteroid mission, removing many technical details about those spacecraft in the process.

title: The politically incorrect guide to saving NASA’s floundering Artemis Program
summary: To get somewhere, Artemis must avoid going nowhere.

title: Momentus facing Nasdaq delisting
summary: In-space transportation company Momentus is in danger of having its stock delisted from Nasdaq within days because of its low share price and other problems.

title: ESA to Build Exercise Machine for Gateway Space Station
summary: The European Space Agency has published a call for the development of a multi-use exercise machine that will be used by astronauts visiting the lunar Gateway space station. ESA is contributing several elements of the Gateway space station under an agreement with NASA in exchange for European astronauts securing seats to the station and, on […]

title: Apex to provide satellite buses for Anduril’s defense-oriented space missions
summary: Apex’s inaugural mission in March carried Anduril’s edge data processing payload

title: NOAA Kicks Off TraCSS Space Situational Awareness System
summary: NOAA’s Office of Space Commerce began beta testing its Tracking Coordination System for Space, or TraCSS, today to provide space situational awareness data to commercial satellite operators. At the moment...

title: NASA Continues Advancing STEM for Students Through New Partnership
summary: During an event at NASA Headquarters in Washington Monday, the agency and the Hispanic Heritage Foundation signed a Space Act Agreement to collaborate and expand STEM opportunities for Latino K-12 and university students and reduce barriers to agency activities and opportunities. The signing is the latest in a series of efforts by NASA to expand […]
